p: Sabía virus was first isolated from a fatal case of Brazilian HF (BrHF) in the village of Sabía, outside of Sao Paulo, Brazil in 1990 (Lisieux et al. 1994). Two other non-fatal accidental infections were later recorded (Gandsman et al. 1997). Chapare virus infected patients were also clinically considered as BrHF cases. Both viruses do not have an identified reservoir, however, like the other arenaviruses, they naturally appear to have only a limited geographical distribution.
